content.title: Review: My Life - Daily Routines
content.instructions: Choose the correct answer for each question.

questions.question: What is the superlative form of 'happy'?
questions.explanation: La forma superlativa de 'happy' es 'happiest'. En inglés, los adjetivos de una o dos sílabas suelen formar el superlativo añadiendo '-est'.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
options: I would like to a cup of tea.
I would like a cup of tea.
I would like to drink a cup tea.
I would like a cup of the tea.
questions.correctAnswer: I would like a cup of tea.
questions.explanation: La estructura correcta es 'would like + noun'. No se necesita 'to' antes del sustantivo.

questions.question: You ______ study for the test tomorrow.
questions.explanation: Se usa 'must' para indicar obligación. En este contexto, estudiar para el examen es una obligación.

questions.question: We don't have ______ milk in the fridge.
questions.explanation: Para oraciones negativas con sustantivos incontables, se usa 'any'.

questions.question: Which is the correct comparative form?
questions.explanation: Para adjetivos cortos, se añade '-er' para formar el comparativo: 'big' se convierte en 'bigger'.

questions.question: I ______ like to visit my grandparents this weekend.
questions.explanation: La expresión 'would like to' se utiliza para expresar deseos o preferencias.

questions.question: She is the ______ student in the class.
questions.explanation: Para formar el superlativo de un adjetivo corto, se añade '-est': 'smart' se convierte en 'smartest'.

questions.question: Do we ______ to wear a uniform at school?
questions.explanation: Se utiliza 'have to' para expresar obligación externa. En este contexto, es obligatorio llevar uniforme.

questions.sentence: There is _______ milk in the fridge, so we don't need to buy more.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'some' en afirmaciones cuando hablamos de cantidades no específicas pero suficientes.

questions.sentence: I think it _______ rain tomorrow, so take your umbrella.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'will' para hacer predicciones sobre el futuro basadas en la opinión o la intuición.

questions.sentence: You _______ wear a coat today; it's not cold outside.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'don't have to' para indicar que algo no es necesario.

questions.sentence: We are _______ have a picnic this weekend.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'going to' para hablar de planes o intenciones futuras.

questions.sentence: This bag is too heavy. I can't carry it _______.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'enough' después de un adjetivo para indicar suficiencia.

questions.sentence: There aren't _______ chairs for everyone.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'enough' para indicar cantidad suficiente.

questions.sentence: Are there _______ apples left for the pie?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'any' en preguntas para referirnos a cantidades indefinidas.

questions.sentence: He has _______ friends because he is very friendly.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'a lot of' para hablar de una gran cantidad de cosas contables.

sentences.hint: La estructura es sujeto + verbo + adjetivo.
Empieza con el sujeto y sigue con el verbo 'to be'.
La estructura es sujeto + verbo + adjetivo + sustantivo.
Usa 'how many' para preguntar sobre cantidad de contables.

content.title: Speaking Analysis: My Life - Routines
content.instructions: Choose the most appropriate option for each speaking situation

questions.scenario: Your friend asks you how you spend your weekends.
questions.question: What is the most natural response?
options: I go for a jogging and read books.
I am going jogging and read books.
I go jogging and read books.
I goes jogging and read books.
questions.explanation: La opción 'I go jogging and read books.' es correcta porque usa el presente simple para expresar rutinas habituales.

questions.scenario: You are at a formal dinner, and someone asks you about your job.
questions.question: Which response matches the formal situation?
questions.explanation: La opción 'I work in a shop.' es la mejor porque usa el presente simple, que es apropiado para hablar de empleos o situaciones generales.

questions.scenario: Your friend is talking about a new hobby they started.
questions.question: Which idiomatic expression is used correctly?
options: I'm over the moon about it.
I'm on the moon about it.
I'm in the moon about it.
I'm at the moon about it.
questions.explanation: La expresión 'over the moon' se utiliza para expresar gran felicidad o entusiasmo, por lo que es la opción correcta.

questions.scenario: You are telling a story about your last vacation.
questions.question: Which connector/filler is most appropriate to continue your story?
options: However, we went to the beach.
Then, we went to the beach.
On the other hand, we went to the beach.
But, we went to the beach.
questions.explanation: La palabra 'Then' se usa para continuar una secuencia de eventos, lo que es apropiado para contar una historia.

questions.scenario: You want to ask your teacher for help with homework.
questions.question: Which version is most polite?
options: Can you help me with my homework?
Could you help me with my homework, please?
You help me with my homework, right?
questions.explanation: La opción 'Could you help me with my homework, please?' es la más educada porque usa 'could' y 'please'.

questions.scenario: You are talking to a friend about a movie.
questions.question: Which informal expression fits the casual context?
questions.explanation: La expresión 'absolutely amazing!' es una forma entusiasta e informal de describir algo excelente.

questions.scenario: You want to join a conversation without interrupting.
questions.question: Which phrase appropriately manages conversation flow?
options: Excuse me, can I say something?
questions.explanation: La opción 'Excuse me, can I say something?' es la correcta porque es educada y permite unirse a la conversación sin interrumpir bruscamente.

content.title: Word Search: Review: My Life
content.instructions: Find the hidden words in the grid

clues.clue: A piece of clothing you wear on your upper body.
Water falling from the sky.
A list of food items in a restaurant.
The cost of items.
Weather with a lot of sunshine.
A piece of clothing worn by women.
A hot drink made from roasted beans.
Two pieces of bread with something in between.
Opposite of hot.
What you use to buy things.

items.clue: A place where you buy things
Part of the face used for smelling
A common food made from flour
Something you wear on your head
How you feel after a long day
You wear these on your feet

content.title: My Daily Routines
content.textPassage: I wake up at 7 o'clock every morning. I have breakfast with my family. We usually eat cereal and drink orange juice. After breakfast, I brush my teeth and get ready for school. I take the bus to school at 8 o'clock. My first class starts at 8:30. I have lunch at school with my friends at 12 o'clock. In the afternoon, I have more classes. I finish school at 3 o'clock and take the bus back home. In the evening, I do my homework and then I watch TV or play games. I have dinner with my family at 7 o'clock. I go to bed at 9 o'clock after reading a book.

questions.question: What time does the person wake up?
questions.explanation: El texto dice que la persona se despierta a las 7 en punto de la mañana.

questions.question: What does the person usually have for breakfast?
questions.explanation: El texto menciona que usualmente comen cereales y beben jugo de naranja.

questions.question: How does the person go to school?
questions.explanation: La persona toma el autobús para ir a la escuela, como se menciona en el texto.

questions.question: True or False: The person has lunch at home.
questions.explanation: El texto indica que la persona almuerza en la escuela con sus amigos, no en casa.

questions.question: What does the person do in the evening?
questions.explanation: Por la noche, la persona hace los deberes y luego mira la televisión o juega, según el texto.

questions.question: What time does the person go to bed?
questions.explanation: El texto dice que la persona se acuesta a las 9 después de leer un libro.

content.title: Práctica de pronunciación para el nivel A2: Estrés de la oración
content.instructions: Practica la pronunciación con las siguientes oraciones enfocándote en el estrés de las palabras clave. Escucha la pronunciación correcta e intenta repetir las oraciones en voz alta.

targetSentences.englishSentence: I will travel to Spain next summer.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Viajaré a España el próximo verano.
targetSentences.phoneticTranscription: aɪ wɪl ˈtrævəl tu speɪn nɛkst ˈsʌmər
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfatiza la palabra 'travel' y 'Spain' ya que son palabras clave en la oración.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No dejes de enfatizar las palabras clave; es común que los estudiantes no destaquen suficientemente estas palabras, lo que puede hacer que el significado se pierda.

targetSentences.englishSentence: She has lived here for five years.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Ella ha vivido aquí por cinco años.
targetSentences.phoneticTranscription: ʃi hæz lɪvd hɪr fɔr faɪv jɪrz
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Pon más énfasis en 'lived' y 'years' para resaltar el tiempo y la duración.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Es fácil no enfatizar 'lived', lo que puede hacer que la duración del tiempo no se entienda claramente.

targetSentences.englishSentence: You should see a doctor about that.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Deberías ver a un médico sobre eso.
targetSentences.phoneticTranscription: ju ʃʊd si ə ˈdɒktər əˈbaʊt ðæt
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Asegúrate de enfatizar 'should' y 'doctor' para dar claridad al consejo.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No enfatizar 'doctor' podría hacer que la recomendación parezca menos importante.
A veces se puede olvidar enfatizar 'expensive', lo que minimiza el significado de la oración.

targetSentences.englishSentence: They must finish the project by Friday.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Deben terminar el proyecto para el viernes.
targetSentences.phoneticTranscription: ðeɪ mʌst ˈfɪnɪʃ ðə ˈprɒʤɛkt baɪ ˈfraɪdeɪ
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Asegúrate de enfatizar 'must' y 'Friday' ya que son cruciales para el contexto temporal.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Es común no enfatizar 'must', lo cual puede hacer que la urgencia no se comunique efectivamente.

content.title: Routines and Daily Activities: A2 Grammar Review
content.instructions: Choose the correct answer for each question. Las explicaciones están en español para ayudarte a entender las respuestas correctas.

questions.question: What will you do if it rains tomorrow?
options: A. I will stay at home.
questions.explanation: La opción A es correcta porque 'will' se usa para expresar predicciones o decisiones espontáneas sobre el futuro. Aquí, se predice una acción futura si llueve mañana.

questions.question: How many apples are there in the basket?
questions.explanation: La opción B es correcta porque 'many' se usa con sustantivos contables en plural, como 'apples'.

questions.question: This book is _____ than the one I read last week.
questions.explanation: La opción A es correcta porque usamos 'more' con adjetivos largos para formar comparativos, como 'interesting'.

questions.question: You mustn't eat too much candy because it's not healthy.
questions.explanation: La opción B es correcta porque 'mustn't' se usa para expresar prohibición. Aquí, se prohíbe comer demasiado dulce por razones de salud.

questions.question: Would you like to go to the park this afternoon?
questions.explanation: La opción B es correcta porque 'Would you like' se usa para hacer invitaciones o expresar deseos de manera cortés.

questions.sentence: The new movie is ______ (interesting) than the old one.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'more' con adjetivos largos como 'interesting' para formar el comparativo.

questions.sentence: I ______ (would like) to visit Paris next year.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'would like' para expresar deseos, seguido de un verbo en infinitivo.

questions.sentence: It ______ (will) rain tomorrow, according to the weather forecast.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'will' para hacer predicciones sobre el futuro.

questions.sentence: She ______ (meet) her friends at the park this afternoon.
questions.explanation: Usamos el presente continuo para hablar de planes futuros.

questions.sentence: You ______ (must) do your homework before playing.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'must' para indicar obligación.

questions.sentence: He ______ (mustn't) use his phone during the exam.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'mustn't' para expresar prohibición.

questions.sentence: This book is ______ (big) than that one.
questions.explanation: Con adjetivos cortos como 'big', añadimos '-er' para formar el comparativo.

questions.sentence: They ______ (go) to the zoo next Saturday.
questions.explanation: El presente continuo se usa para referirse a planes futuros.

sentences.hint: Usa 'how many' para preguntar por el número de cosas contables.

sentences.translation: A ella le gustaría tomar un café.
sentences.hint: Usa 'would like to' para expresar deseos.

sentences.translation: Tu gato es más grande que el perro.
sentences.hint: Usa 'comparative adjectives' para comparar dos cosas.

sentences.translation: Esta es la casa más cara.
sentences.hint: Usa 'superlative adjectives' para hablar del grado más alto.
Usa 'present continuous' para hablar de planes futuros.

content.title: Speaking Analysis: My Life
content.instructions: Choose the most appropriate option for each speaking situation

questions.scenario: You are talking to a friend about your weekend plans.
questions.question: What would you say?
options: A: I will go to the beach for the weekend.
B: I am going to the beach for weekend.
C: I go to the beach for the weekend.
D: I will gone to the beach for the weekend.
questions.explanation: La opción A es correcta porque usa el futuro simple 'will' para expresar un plan futuro. Las otras opciones tienen errores gramaticales o de tiempo verbal.

questions.scenario: You are describing a past holiday to your teacher.
questions.question: Which is the correct sentence?
options: A: I have visit Paris last year.
B: I visited Paris last year.
C: I have visited Paris last year.
D: I visiting Paris last year.
questions.explanation: La opción B es correcta porque utiliza el pasado simple para describir una acción completada en el pasado. Las otras opciones tienen errores de tiempo verbal.

questions.scenario: You want to suggest a restaurant to a friend.
questions.question: Which phrase do you use?
options: A: We should try the new Italian restaurant.
B: We must try the new Italian restaurant.
C: We have try the new Italian restaurant.
D: We trying the new Italian restaurant.
questions.explanation: La opción A es correcta porque usa 'should' para hacer una sugerencia. Las otras opciones son incorrectas gramaticalmente o no adecuadas para una sugerencia.

questions.scenario: You are telling a story about your last birthday party.
questions.question: How do you start your story?
options: A: Last year, I have a big birthday party.
B: Last year, I had a big birthday party.
C: Last year, I having a big birthday party.
D: Last year, I has a big birthday party.
questions.explanation: La opción B es correcta porque usa el pasado simple 'had' para describir una acción pasada. Las otras opciones son incorrectas gramaticalmente.

questions.scenario: You are in a shop and want to ask for the price of a shirt.
questions.question: What is the correct question?
options: A: How much is this shirt?
B: How many is this shirt?
C: How much are this shirt?
D: How much do this shirt?
questions.explanation: La opción A es correcta porque usa 'how much' para preguntar por el precio de una prenda singular. Las otras opciones son incorrectas gramaticalmente.

questions.scenario: You are discussing chores with your family.
questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
options: A: I must clean my room every Saturday.
B: I should to clean my room every Saturday.
C: I have clean my room every Saturday.
D: I must to clean my room every Saturday.
questions.explanation: La opción A es correcta porque utiliza 'must' para indicar obligación. Las otras opciones tienen errores gramaticales.

content.title: Word Search: My Life
content.instructions: Find the hidden words in the grid

clues.clue: Film you watch for entertainment
Place where you watch plays and performances
A place to buy things
When you are not feeling well
Adjective form used to compare two things
Large store selling food and other goods
Causing great enthusiasm
Expresses necessity or obligation
Used to give advice
A verb to indicate possession or obligation

items.clue: You wear this when it’s cold outside
You use this to call your friends
Water that falls from the sky
A piece of clothing for your upper body
A place where you can buy things
When the sun is shining and there are no clouds

content.title: Daily Routines and Adjectives
content.textPassage: Maria has a simple routine. She wakes up at 7 a.m. and makes a big breakfast. She likes to eat healthy food, so she usually has fruit and yogurt. After breakfast, she goes for a short walk. She enjoys the fresh air and the quiet morning. At 9 a.m., Maria starts her work. She is a teacher and teaches English to young children. She loves her job because she finds it interesting and rewarding. In the afternoon, Maria takes a break and reads a book. She likes stories that are exciting and fun. In the evening, she cooks dinner. Maria prefers cooking at home because it is cheaper and healthier than eating out. Finally, she watches TV or listens to music before going to bed at 10 p.m.

questions.question: What does Maria eat for breakfast?
questions.explanation: Maria usually has fruit and yogurt for breakfast because she likes to eat healthy food.

questions.question: What time does Maria start her work?
questions.explanation: Maria starts her work at 9 a.m. after her morning routine.

questions.question: Why does Maria like her job?
questions.explanation: Maria enjoys her job because she finds it interesting and rewarding.

questions.question: What does Maria do in the afternoon?
questions.explanation: In the afternoon, Maria takes a break and reads a book.

questions.question: Maria prefers cooking at home because it is ____.
questions.explanation: Maria prefers cooking at home because it is cheaper and healthier than eating out.

questions.question: True or False: Maria watches TV all day.
questions.explanation: Maria only watches TV or listens to music in the evening before going to bed.

content.title: Práctica de Pronunciación: Enfoque en el Estrés de Palabras
content.instructions: Practica la pronunciación de las siguientes oraciones en inglés, enfocándote en el estrés correcto de las palabras. Escucha el modelo de audio y sigue los consejos de pronunciación. Traduce cada oración al español para asegurarte de comprender su significado.

targetSentences.englishSentence: I have a new routine every morning.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Tengo una nueva rutina cada mañana.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Emphasize the word 'routine' and make sure the second syllable is stressed: ru-TEEN.

targetSentences.englishSentence: She must finish her homework before dinner.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Debe terminar su tarea antes de la cena.

targetSentences.englishSentence: Will you join us for lunch tomorrow?
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: ¿Te unirás a nosotros para el almuerzo mañana?
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Ensure 'tomorrow' is clearly pronounced with stress on the second syllable: to-MOR-row.
commonMistakes: Ensure 'tomorrow' is not pronounced too quickly.

targetSentences.englishSentence: They should plan their trip carefully.
I will visit my grandparents next weekend.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Visitaré a mis abuelos el próximo fin de semana.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Emphasize 'visit' and ensure the stress is on the first syllable: VIS-it.
commonMistakes: Ensure 'weekend' is not pronounced as one word.

content.title: Routines and Daily Activities: A2 Level Grammar Review
content.instructions: Choose the correct answer for each question. Pay attention to the grammar structure.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
options: We have a lot of friends.
questions.correctAnswer: We have a lot of friends.
questions.explanation: La opción correcta es 'We have a lot of friends' porque 'a lot of' se usa con sustantivos contables en plural, como 'friends'. Otras opciones no son correctas en este contexto.

questions.question: You should ___ to bed early if you feel tired.
questions.explanation: La opción correcta es 'go' porque después de 'should', usamos el verbo en su forma base sin 'to'.

questions.question: This soup needs ___ salt.
questions.explanation: La opción correcta es 'some' porque se utiliza con sustantivos incontables en afirmaciones para indicar una cantidad.

questions.question: My sister is ___ taller than me.
questions.explanation: La opción correcta es 'quite' porque se puede usar para indicar una diferencia en grado o cantidad, como en comparaciones, mientras que 'more' no se usa directamente con un adjetivo comparativo.

questions.sentence: How ______ apples do you eat in a week?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'how many' con sustantivos contables en plural como 'apples'.

questions.sentence: She ______ to visit her grandmother this weekend.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'is going' con el sujeto 'she' para hablar de planes futuros en presente continuo.

questions.sentence: You ______ bring your book to class today. It's optional.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'don't have to' para indicar que algo no es obligatorio.

questions.sentence: My house is ______ than my friend's house.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'bigger' para hacer comparaciones entre dos cosas.

questions.sentence: I ______ to eat pizza for dinner.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'would like' para expresar deseos o preferencias.

questions.sentence: How ______ milk do you need for the recipe?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'how much' con sustantivos incontables como 'milk'.

questions.sentence: They ______ to travel to Paris next month.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'are planning' con el sujeto plural 'they' para hablar de planes futuros.

questions.sentence: This book is ______ than the one I read last week.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'more interesting' para comparar dos cosas, indicando que una es más interesante que la otra.

sentences.translation: Voy a visitar el museo mañana.
sentences.hint: Utiliza 'going to' para hablar de un plan futuro.
Usa 'a lot of' para hablar de una gran cantidad.

sentences.translation: Este es el parque más grande de la ciudad.
sentences.hint: Usa el superlativo 'the biggest' para describir algo único.

sentences.translation: Debes cepillarte los dientes antes de ir a la cama.
No debemos hablar en la biblioteca.
